statements: UPDATE patient_data SET lab_test_results = '{"blood_pressure": 120}' WHERE patient_id = 1;
UPDATE patient_data SET imaging_studies = '{"x_ray": "normal"}' WHERE patient_id = 2;
UPDATE patient_data SET lab_test_results = '{"blood_test": "normal", "urine_test": "abnormal"}', imaging_studies = '{"x-ray": "clear", "MRI": "abnormal"}' WHERE patient_id = 12345;

UPDATE patient_data SET patient_reports = '{"summary": "patient is stable", "recommendations": ["follow-up in 2 weeks", "prescribe medication"]}', lab_test_results = '{"blood_test": "abnormal", "urine_test": "normal"}' WHERE patient_id = 54321;
UPDATE lab_tests SET test_result = 'Negative' WHERE test_id = 1;
UPDATE imaging_studies SET study_type = 'MRI' WHERE patient_id = 123;
UPDATE lab_tests SET test_result = 'Positive' WHERE test_id = 1;
UPDATE imaging_studies SET study_type = 'MRI Scan', result_path = '/results/mri_scan.pdf' WHERE patient_id = 100;
UPDATE lab_tests SET test_name='Blood Test', test_date='2022-06-15' WHERE test_id=1;
UPDATE imaging_studies SET image_url='http://example.com/image123.jpg', study_type='X-ray' WHERE study_id=3;
UPDATE lab_tests SET test_name = 'Complete Blood Count' WHERE test_id = 101;
UPDATE patient_reports SET report_text = 'Patient has shown improvement in symptoms.' WHERE report_id = 201;

UPDATE imaging_studies SET study_date='2022-01-15' WHERE patient_id=201;
UPDATE lab_tests SET test_result = 'Negative' WHERE test_id = 1;
UPDATE patient_reports SET report_text = 'Patient has recovered completely.' WHERE patient_id = 101 AND report_date = '2022-10-15';
UPDATE LabTests SET test_result = 'Negative' WHERE lab_test_id = 1;
UPDATE ImagingStudies SET study_result = 'Normal' WHERE patient_id = 3;
UPDATE LabTests SET test_result = 'Positive', test_date = '2022-10-15' WHERE lab_test_id = 101;
UPDATE ImagingStudies SET study_result = 'Normal', study_date = '2022-09-20' WHERE imaging_study_id = 201;
